intro: Mariscus tanyphyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
